title: AU-ABC Program  · Angelo State University
description: Discover how Angelo State supports active-duty Airmen through the AU-ABC Program, offering streamlined paths to bachelor’s degrees for military personnel.

headings: Notice Regarding Changing Majors to non-AU-ABC Programs
paragraphs: The Air University Associate-to-Baccalaureate Cooperative (AU-ABC) is designed to provide bachelor degree opportunities for any active Airmen of the United States Air Force, Air Force Reserve or Air National Guard, and Guardians of the United States Space Force.

Air University has partnered with military friendly institutions willing to maximize credit earned through the Associate of Applied Science (AAS) degree awarded by the Community College of the Air Force (CCAF).
TheASU course schedulewill show you what specific classes are being offered.
Program plan files show the CCAF credits that apply to each degree, as well as the remaining credits that students are required to complete in the program.

The Office of Admissions, in conjunction with the Department of Security Studies and Criminal Justice, will make an exception to standard Angelo State University policy with regard to Community College of the Air Force (CCAF) credits. As a student majoring in any of the security studies or border security degrees, all credits from CCAF associate degrees will be accepted and applied toward your degree plan of choice. However, should you choose to change your degree plan to a degree other than security studies or border security, the transfer credits originally accepted and applied may be revoked. Again, exception to standard ASU policy will be retracted if you later choose a non-security studies/border security degree plan.
For more information about the AU-ABC Program and how to get started, contact the Admissions Counselor for Military Affiliated Programs.

Builds on your Community College of the Air Force (CCAF) degree.
CCAF graduates earn bachelor’s degrees after completingno more than 60 semester hours beyond their associate degree.
Maximizes the application of your military career education and training.
Based in a virtual campus instruction.
Every participant receives a binding degree completion contract that locks-in transfer credit and states remaining degree requirements.

Maximized Acceptance of Transfer Credits. The AU-ABC degree plans in the Department of Security Studies and Criminal Justice will fully accept the credits from the student’s CCAF degree plus additional courses from other schools. The major courses must be completed through online or in-resident enrollment at Angelo State University.
Bachelor of Applied Arts and Sciences (Specialization in Adult Education)
Bachelor of Applied Arts and Sciences (Specialization in Computer Science)
Bachelor of Applied Arts and Sciences (Specialization in Criminal Justice)

2.0 cumulative GPA on all transferable college work
